Description: Fragment of shoulder with turn to neck of East Greek pottery amphora or oenochoe; slight ridge at base of neck. Cream slip. Minimal part of neck decoration preserved; frieze of simple tongues, some with added red, between lines at top of shoulder; below, volute and leaf composition almost mimicking the head and neck of a grazing deer; set of three strokes and half-rosette as fill pendent from upper border.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VIII, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.003)
